title: Exotic Weil Self-Intersection Across All Nine Heegner Fields (Paper 57, Constructive Reverse Mathematics and Arithmetic Geometry Series)
description:
Paper 57 of the Constructive Reverse Mathematics and Arithmetic Geometry series. We extend Paper 56 to all nine class-number-1 imaginary quadratic fields, completing the Baker–Heegner–Stark landscape: d ∈ {1, 2, 3, 7, 11, 19, 43, 67, 163}.

For each field K = Q(√(−d)), we compute the trace matrix, verify the discriminant via native_decide, derive the Weil class degree via the cyclic conductor theorem (disc(F) = conductor², so d₀ = conductor), and assemble the full 9-row pattern table with Heuristic Regularity and Dispensability of Physical Totality verdicts.

Results: d=1 → disc=81, deg=9; d=2 → disc=361, deg=19; d=3 → disc=49, deg=7; d=7 → disc=169, deg=13; d=11 → disc=1369, deg=37; d=19 → disc=3721, deg=61; d=43 → disc=6241, deg=79; d=67 → disc=26569, deg=163; d=163 → disc=9409, deg=97.

The Lean 4 / Mathlib formalization comprises 3 active modules (~918 lines) plus 1 deprecated module, totaling ~1,257 lines. Sorry budget: 1 principled axiom (weil_class_degree_eq_conductor), 0 gaps. All nine discriminant and Gram matrix computations are machine-verified.

Code is distributed exclusively via this Zenodo record.
